channel.title: My Old Kentucky Blog
channel.description: a music blog that parties with unicorns

item.title: Video : Cat Power : “Manhattan”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Chan Marshall herself, aka Cat Power, and Greg Hunt directed the new video for Sun cut “Manhattan.” The video takes you through floats through New York as Marshall dances and enjoys the city’s offerings. It is not a mind-blowing concept, but gives you some great imagery and allows Marshall’s captivating personality flow. [...]
item.content:encoded: Chan Marshall herself, aka Cat Power, and Greg Hunt directed the new video for Sun cut “Manhattan.” The video takes you through floats through New York as Marshall dances and enjoys the city’s offerings. It is not a mind-blowing concept, but gives you some great imagery and allows Marshall’s captivating personality flow. Watch below.

item.title: Video : Bibio : Silver Wilkinson Album Sampler
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Last month, Stephen Wilkinson, better known to the world as Bibio, announced the release of a forthcoming full-length, Silver Wilkinson, to be released on May 14 via Warp Records. To accompany the announcement, he provided the first single “À tout à l’heure” for streaming and download. Today, he released album sampler video featuring [...]
item.content:encoded: Last month, Stephen Wilkinson, better known to the world as Bibio, announced the release of a forthcoming full-length, Silver Wilkinson, to be released on May 14 via Warp Records. To accompany the announcement, he provided the first single “À tout à l’heure” for streaming and download. Today, he released album sampler video featuring visuals, created by Bibio, that bring to life the artwork of the album. Check it out below.

item.title: Song : Little Daylight : “Name In Lights”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Indie pop trio Little Daylight are primed for a breakout year in 2013. They already made waves with remixes for Passion Pit, Penguin Prison, and Temper Trap along with the previously released “Overdose” (see stream and video below). Now we get the slow, but catchy second song from the band titled “Name In Lights” [...]
item.content:encoded:
Indie pop trio Little Daylight are primed for a breakout year in 2013. They already made waves with remixes for Passion Pit, Penguin Prison, and Temper Trap along with the previously released “Overdose” (see stream and video below). Now we get the slow, but catchy second song from the band titled “Name In Lights” found below. The band will be heading out on tour with Charli XCX beginning at the end of May.

Previous:

Tour Dates:
04/04 – New York, NY @ Santos Party House (Neon Gold POPSHOP)
04/11 – Washington, DC @ All Things Gold @ U Street Music Hall,
05/31 – Brooklyn, NY @ Glasslands*
06/01 – Philadelphia, PA @ Union Transfer*
06/03 – Washington, DC @ U Street Music Hall*
06/04 – Norfolk, VA @ The NorVa*
06/06 – Orlando, FL @ The Social*
06/10 – Charlotte, NC @ Visulite Theatre*

*with Charli XCX

item.title: Video : Still Corners : “Berlin Lovers”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Skating rinks are making a comeback in 2013 if music videos are an indicator. Earlier this week, we had a roller disco visual from CHVRCHES for their song “Now Is Not The Time”, now we get roller rink love story from Still Corners for their song “Berlin Lovers”. The clip for the airy [...]
item.content:encoded: Skating rinks are making a comeback in 2013 if music videos are an indicator. Earlier this week, we had a roller disco visual from CHVRCHES for their song “Now Is Not The Time”, now we get roller rink love story from Still Corners for their song “Berlin Lovers”. The clip for the airy synthpop cut shows members of the band looking on as two teenagers find love on the rink. It was directed by Christian Sorensen Hansen. Strange Pleasures is out May 7th via Sub Pop. Watch below.

item.title: Song : Weekend : “Mirror”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Brookly via San Francisco band Weekend released the first sample from their new LP, Jinx. “Mirror” will appear on the sophomore album and grabs you immediately at first listen. The album was recorded with Monte Vallier (The Soft Moon, Young Prisms, Wax Idols), who assisted with their debut album Sports and Red EP. [...]
item.content:encoded: Brookly via San Francisco band Weekend released the first sample from their new LP, Jinx. “Mirror” will appear on the sophomore album and grabs you immediately at first listen. The album was recorded with Monte Vallier (The Soft Moon, Young Prisms, Wax Idols), who assisted with their debut album Sports and Red EP. We are really excited about this one. Jinx is out July 23rd courtesy of Slumberland Records. Listen below.

item.title: Song : Prince : “Let’s Go Crazy” (New Version)
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Prince has been heavy in the news the past month with his performance at SXSW, random videos infiltrating the internet, and filing of a cease and disist order against Vine. In most cases, this much Prince in the public domain means we should be expecting some sort of release in the near future. [...]
item.content:encoded: Prince has been heavy in the news the past month with his performance at SXSW, random videos infiltrating the internet, and filing of a cease and disist order against Vine. In most cases, this much Prince in the public domain means we should be expecting some sort of release in the near future. You can add this reworked version of Prince classic “Let’s Go Crazy” to the barrage. The update is slower than the original has a more bluesy feel to it with heavy distortion and excessive guitar solos (in the best way possible). Listen to it below.

item.title: Song : Deerhunter : “Monomania” + Fallon Performance
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: On May 7th, Bradford Cox and his band Deerhunter will be releasing their sixth studio album, Monomania, via 4AD. The band posted a stream of the title track last night along with performing the song on Late Night with Jimmy Fallon. During the performance, Cox revealed his new alter ego “Connie Lungpin” and [...]
item.content:encoded: On May 7th, Bradford Cox and his band Deerhunter will be releasing their sixth studio album, Monomania, via 4AD. The band posted a stream of the title track last night along with performing the song on Late Night with Jimmy Fallon. During the performance, Cox revealed his new alter ego “Connie Lungpin” and showed, once again, why he just might be the most interesting artist that rock music at the moment. His unpredictability is a rarity nowadays. Listen to the song and watch the performance below.

item.title: Video : James Blake : “Voyeur”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: An animated record spinning on a turntable slowly transforms into a geometric world in the Ferry Gouw-animated video for James Blake track “Voyeur”. Blake’s Voyeur Dub/And Holy Ghost 12″ is out later this month on 1-800-Dinosaur and new album Overgrown is out April 8th on Atlas/Republic. Watch below.
item.content:encoded: An animated record spinning on a turntable slowly transforms into a geometric world in the Ferry Gouw-animated video for James Blake track “Voyeur”. Blake’s Voyeur Dub/And Holy Ghost 12″ is out later this month on 1-800-Dinosaur and new album Overgrown is out April 8th on Atlas/Republic. Watch below.

item.title: [WIN THIS!] : Oblivion Soundtrack Limited Edition Vinyl + Film Prize Pack
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: On April 9th, Back Lot Records will be releasing the soundtrack to the highly anticipated movie, Oblivion, starring Tom Cruise. The soundtrack features new music by Anthony Gonzalez of M83 and Joseph Trapanese (TRON: Uprising, The Raid: Redemption). It has 16 score cues along with a brand new song featuring Norwegian singer-songwriter Susanne Sundfør [...]
item.content:encoded:
On April 9th, Back Lot Records will be releasing the soundtrack to the highly anticipated movie, Oblivion, starring Tom Cruise. The soundtrack features new music by Anthony Gonzalez of M83 and Joseph Trapanese (TRON: Uprising, The Raid: Redemption). It has 16 score cues along with a brand new song featuring Norwegian singer-songwriter Susanne Sundfør that is used as the end title for the flick.

Gonzalez stated regarding the scoring process, “It was challenging, to say, writing the music for Oblivion during my tour with M83. In the back of the tour bus, I had a small set up and was making music whenever I could. It was a little complicated at first but a great way to take a break from the tour and lose myself in Oblivion’s score. Joseph Kosinski had a pretty good idea of what the music would be for the movie, and it took me finding a way to make him happy and make me happy during the process. The soundtrack is truly a collaboration between Joseph Kosinki, Joe Trapanese and myself.”

One lucky reader will win the following:
(1) LIMITED EDITION MONDO VINYL of the upcoming OBLIVION soundtrack
(1) Oblivion 3D Puzzle
(1) Oblivion Collapsible Water Bottle
(1) Oblivion Hat

All you have to do is follow MOKB on Twitter and like us on Facebook. Once you have done that, give us a shout on our Facebook page or hit us with a tweet using the hashtag #OblivionPrizePack no later than noon on April 9th. We will randomly pick someone at that time. If you don’t want to leave getting the soundtrack to chance, you can pre-order it here.

item.title: Video : Charli XCX : “What I Like”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: British pop singer Charli XCX gets her slumber party on in the new visual for “What I Like”. The song appears on her forthcoming album, True Romance, out on April 15th via Asylum Records. The low-fi clip has almost a web cam feel to it and was directed by Ryan Andrews. Watch [...]
item.content:encoded: British pop singer Charli XCX gets her slumber party on in the new visual for “What I Like”. The song appears on her forthcoming album, True Romance, out on April 15th via Asylum Records. The low-fi clip has almost a web cam feel to it and was directed by Ryan Andrews. Watch below.
